intro: Polyochnella integrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leafed fern, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, pinnately arranged leaves that are smooth and lack any serrations. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
